briefdescription.para: Define a read-only iterable section output.

detaileddescription.para: Define an output section which will set up an iterable area of equally-sized data structures. For use with STRUCT_SECTION_ITERABLE(). Input sections will be sorted by name, per ld's SORT_BY_NAME.
This macro should be used for read-only data.
Note that this keeps the symbols in the image even though they are not being directly referenced. Use this when symbols are indirectly referenced by iterating through the section.

briefdescription.para: Define a garbage collectable read-only iterable section output.

detaileddescription.para: Define an output section which will set up an iterable area of equally-sized data structures. For use with STRUCT_SECTION_ITERABLE(). Input sections will be sorted by name, per ld's SORT_BY_NAME.
This macro should be used for read-only data.
Note that the symbols within the section can be garbage collected.

briefdescription.para: Define a read-write iterable section output.

detaileddescription.para: Define an output section which will set up an iterable area of equally-sized data structures. For use with STRUCT_SECTION_ITERABLE(). Input sections will be sorted by name, per ld's SORT_BY_NAME.
This macro should be used for read-write data that is modified at runtime.
Note that this keeps the symbols in the image even though they are not being directly referenced. Use this when symbols are indirectly referenced by iterating through the section.

briefdescription.para: Define a garbage collectable read-write iterable section output.

detaileddescription.para: Define an output section which will set up an iterable area of equally-sized data structures. For use with STRUCT_SECTION_ITERABLE(). Input sections will be sorted by name, per ld's SORT_BY_NAME.
This macro should be used for read-write data that is modified at runtime.
Note that the symbols within the section can be garbage collected.
